head.name: General tokenization pattern for ideographic languages
head.desc: This experimental tokenization pattern takes any text in any ideographic language, delimits every character with spaces, and tokenizes on spaces. This tokenization pattern is suitable for transcriptions in languages such as Chinese where there are no word spaces. This tokenization script essentially prompts a user to identify tokens by counting letters, not words. The comment below contains text that can for the convenience of those preparing a transcription file. @when-accessed should be updated, as well as the location URL.
head.comment: I wrote this pattern without any knowledge of ideographic scripts or logosyllabaries. I encourage those of you who do know them to develop this further. I have no plans to enhance this tokenization routine further, but will insert see-also elements pointing to TAN-R-tok files that supersede this one.
